course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Molecular Characterization Chemistry Laboratory l
course.description: This is the laboratory course corresponding to the lectures of CHEM 2410 Physical Chemistry I and CHEM 2310 Fundamentals of Analytical Chemistry. The topic of experiments covered in this course are closely connected with the topics covered in the lecture courses, such as electrochemical equilibrium, chemical instrumental analysis, thermodynamics, etc. For CHEM students only.
course.prerequisites: CHEM 1050 AND (CHEM 2409 OR MATH 2351)
course.corequisites: CHEM 2310 AND CHEM 2410
course.exclusions: CHEM 2350, CHEM 2355, CHEM 2450

reviews.author: Sonic12
reviews.title: Review of CHEM2555
reviews.comment_content:
Expt1. Calibration of Volumetric Glassware

Expt2. Second Law of Thermodynamics: Entropy Variation with Temperature

Expt3. Determination of n-Heptane, n-Octane, and n-Decane in Unknown Samples using GC-FID

Expt4. Electrochemical Equilibrium: Determination of Standard Electrode Potential and Gibbs Energy in an Electrochemical Cell

Expt5. Quantitative Analysis of p-Xylene using FT-IR

The mixture of physical and analytical chem contents.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fine teaching. The briefing video can be somewhat long but contains all the necessary things to carry out the experiments and quizzes. (hope they can edit the video to only the main point tho)

Briefing slides are also uploaded on canvas, so you can check them anytime you want.

During the class, all the TAs and the professor are helpful. You can always ask things when you're unsure.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab quiz (20%)
Lab performance (20%)
Report (60%)

Grading is ok. Just be careful every time you submit an e-report. Always good to double-check things you typed.

Lab quiz 1: 15/20
Lab quiz 2: 20/20
Lab quiz 3: 20/20
Lab quiz 4: 20/20
Lab quiz 5: 20/20

Report 1: 109/109
Report 2: 58/61
Report 3: 117/118
Report 4: 53/54
Report 5: 49/49

Overall: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The main workload comes from the shittiness of the e-report system. This system is so fucked up that even if you write the right answer but the format is not right, you got a zero mark.

Lab quizzes are easy. Just read through the lab manuals and watch briefing videos for each experiment.

The e-report questions are also not hard. Mostly just copying your datasheet and some simple calculations. But the abovementioned danger of getting zero marks for not matching the marking criteria drives people to be paranoid about what they type in. And this takes up a lot of time.

reviews.author: YareYaredaze
reviews.title: phy + anchem lab course
reviews.comment_content:
same as what others mention:
But I have to say only Expt3 is somewhat interesting, others are just too boring.

Expt 1: Calibration of Volumetric Glassware
Expt 2: Second Law of Thermodynamics: Entropy variation with Temperature
Expt 3: Determination of n-Heptane, n-Octane and n-Heptane using GC-FID
Expt 4: Electrochemical Equilibrium: Measurement of Standard Electrode Potential and Gibbs Energy in electrochemical system
Expt 5: Quantitative Analysis of p-Xylene using FT-IR
reviews.comment_teaching: TAs are all very helpful, you got little to no pressure doing the labs if you prepared enough. That one TA, you will know who he is, can respond your email less than 3 mins at 23:15. He is truly a legend.
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal Lab Grading,
we have no exam this year, grading is heavily depends on lab report (60%)
mean should be B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is kind of heavy compared to synthetic lab, because you can only submit the lab report one time. Basically, you have to check 2-3 times with your lab mate to make sure your data, your calculation, your calibration graph, all the things in the lab report.

If synthetic lab workload = 1, then this course is around 2.5 (because of how boring it is and the reason mentioned above)

reviews.author: yo~
reviews.comment_content:
Expt 1: Calibration of Volumetric Glassware
Expt 2: Second Law of Thermodynamics: Entropy variation with Temperature
Expt 3: Determination of n-Heptane, n-Octane and n-Heptane using GC-FID
Expt 4: Electrochemical Equilibrium: Measurement of Standard Electrode Potential and Gibbs Energy in electrochemical system
Expt 5: Quantitative Analysis of p-Xylene using FT-IR
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor, TAs and technicians are very nice and help us a lot during each experiment. Although the briefing video is quite long (longest one about 1hr), it is quite useful for having preparation before each lab.
reviews.comment_grading:
60% Lab Reports
20% Lab Quizzes (4-5 MCs per quiz)
20% Lab Performance

Final Grade: B+ (Quite Surprising, expected a B or B- instead)
reviews.comment_workload: Very low workload as the only thing to do after each lab session is the Lab Report and most of the reports are easy. All equations for calculations in lab reports are given in the lab manual and briefing ppt. You just need to pay attention in each lab quiz to get a better score and I think 70% of the questions are quite straight forward. Btw, I think the lab quizzes and lab reports are easier than that of CHEM2550.
